Justification: To assess for any fractures or dislocations in the right arm due to the pain and discomfort following the motor vehicle accident.
To rule out any intracranial injuries or bleeding as the patient is experiencing a headache and dizziness after the accident.
To check for any cervical spine injuries, which are common in motor vehicle accidents and could contribute to the headache and dizziness.
To assess for any signs of infection or anemia that could contribute to the patient's symptoms.
To rule out any electrolyte imbalances that could be contributing to the dizziness.
